intro: Gymnostachyum magis-nervatum, commonly known as the Greater Nerved Gymnostachyum, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with prominent venation, and it produces small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
